page.title: 10FARMING-HOLME FARM,CLAYPOLE
page.content: My father is a farmer. He has been at Holme Farm all his life. Holme Farm is a beef and arable farm and has 350 acres. On the farm he has 200 cattle. He grows barley,reject vegetables that go to the cows, wheat, oil seed rape and grass. He employs one farm worker. My father said he has a full range of machinery for his crops. These include a combine harvester, a hay and straw baler, three tractors with wheels for cultivation, ploughs, disc harrows, power harrows, a chemical sprayer and a fertiliser and manure spreader. He starts work at 7 o'clock and comes home at about 5.30. He has his dinner at home. During harvest he is up soon after dawn and does not come home until dark.
